name: All The Presidents Vices Quiz | U.S. Government | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
John Adams.

	John Adams became the 2nd president and died on the 4th of July.

questions.text: Who were Franklin D. Roosevelt's vice-presidents?
questions.correct: John Garner, Henry Wallace and Harry Truman
options: Thomas Dewey, Charles Curtis and Harry Truman
John Garner, Harry Truman and Alben Barkley
Henry Wallace, Harry Truman and Charles Curtis
questions.explanation:
John Garner, Henry Wallace and Harry Truman.

	FDR was elected to serve four terms, hence the most vices.

questions.text: Who was Dwight D. Eisenhower's vice-president?
questions.explanation:
Richard Nixon.

	Richard Milhous Nixon would become the 37th president of the U.S.

questions.text: Who was John Fitzgerald Kennedy's vice-president?
questions.explanation:
Lyndon Johnson.

	Lyndon Baines Johnson was sworn in as the 36th president, on board Air Force One, after Kennedy's assassination.

questions.text: Who were Richard Milhous Nixon's vice-presidents?
questions.explanation:
Spiro Agnew and Gerald Ford.

	Ford earned the dubious distinction of being the only man to hold the office of vice president and president without being elected.

questions.text: Who was Gerald Rudolph Ford's vice-president?
questions.explanation:
Nelson Rockefeller.

	John D. Rockefeller(Rockefeller Center) David Rockefeller(Chase Manhattan) Nelson Piquet(Brazilian racing driver)

George H. W. Bush

	George Bush was to become the 41st president.

questions.text: Who was George Bush Sr.'s vice-president?
questions.explanation:
Dan Quayle.

	Dan Quayle, head of the potato growers society.

Al Gore.

	Ah! Dear Al 'pregnant chad' Gore, where are you now? Florida I guess...NOT!

questions.text: Who was George W. Bush's vice-president?
